forkee.name: echarts
forkee.description: Apache ECharts is a powerful, interactive charting and data visualization library for browser

issue.title: [Bug] Gap between progressbar and axisLine and labels on both ends in gauge

labels.name: pending
labels.description: We are not sure about whether this is a bug/new feature.

labels.name: en
labels.description: This issue is in English

comment.body:
Hi Team , I tried to add it separately  but while resizing the chart the text will not be in proper place. Can you please help me in this.
![image](https://github.com/apache/echarts/assets/6056807/9d8b11b4-f7a6-41a8-96b5-c15e01e56ec3)

issue.title: [Bug] charts with too many data cannot shows correct value inside tooltip

labels.name: pending
labels.description: We are not sure about whether this is a bug/new feature.

labels.name: en
labels.description: This issue is in English

issue.body:
### Version

5.2.2

### Link to Minimal Reproduction

https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?code=PYBwLglsB2AEC8sDeAoWsAeBBDEDOAXLANprrJnmzQCGAtgKYAqDGYAymAJ4A2DRqKlQDGwHsABORAOQBiAMyLplcgF8ANCvQ1ceADI0ARgx4Ct5AGYwwAMXoQeXGQCVgh4GGDrYWCRBo83gASJgBuDJDCNN54NNB4ALR4DH4W0ppC5HgAFsAA7kRgEgCuDBmZsPgAojw8ECB4-IUlZeboJnUN-ADCwMXQYEQAjAAM5Zn4TKAAIvnQRBYByeNC2RAAJgwA8uESPDQgzaUrImKSMgpKJ5bW7BAAXvywQwBM1-gSHjRgTwCcY21KgMUqEAkQRuYNOYNjJ1jx1nQEgwACyGADs2RGAFYLKFhAArPIWF4jdLmHL5I6tTK0RgyMmZbggJ7SKI_ADmki4DKEIGAjUgMBk7jAnjoPKotIYemAbKg81g0joGzhDAl5DoOiI0GKtWuyoVOr15h0kwgwgA1mYKrAKQVYEVjoC6tAGJxeE9BDbYKJxFJFZd5MobVCbRBgRJQaZnpDrqb9OHPYC7VT3rAXW7uHxrd6Uw6Wmn0L7zgHFEHAapY-Z3P11jQJFwAOIHIjEaSk7zSIYAUmkAF1riAJAxQlBingAKqHRUAOWAoXV6CHI7HeCYJWgwgY6xkJJe8lgc9CCSG5aolfQA7I2F08mmrav6C4OCaJBUXsl9GYrA4WaTNuLf05GRBgaHkX40WDIRQyEeMDGMaMPyEPNHWpCo1k2HYUn2adULTQCLhAsCIKg89rhhRUEQSEYADZsWJeQsRoZFfnkHgXheRdqC_elriZFko1KLi-QFeUZD4CwwC4qUZTlIVFWVdZVS4lCC3MA1wXI6BdmSBYljQqg4MTHNMlUp0bQzd1swob1bVye08MBIsziAwNSOgqtTJAOowD0YybIqMyGE82DdCYc0rQC0z7NTZ1Eys_9vQI0slArSEVAvWBH1gZ9b3vEhsvuF9CAK8oiryh9ynjAAFYBwx-f1iGy9k_HWO9KrIRpoHZPhio6pd6wCPhoya8oQEG2oTD60qyCiPhoDrRrssMEocn69MGHZBgFtbd9yRi2BFh4ZIMrIbLPDEdwMF2qgkPQO1wrAayjuWcxPGnE8Ri-64guuCxQLAYphxMoQ6zAGgAC1gGAOgQeiyl83M71cvwABJBbWBkaAYDVNLMky9BMuysHIeh2G31u_aEcczIbzRjHrpIEZsqoFbx2ydgTAYYRBkO_S-K4ZkZDwOpNgkLjJAgbbeekXI_HuawAnconygkGhFvWvl9iWqrut63R1rV9YIHHabRs6lIpZKpCACINhtogbao2j6P3JiWLYjibZWG3-Id2AbcMetvZUG2pX9m2sFqWBXDyPAQ6oG28DoaGwGyf2XoMgPk9T7IAFkYA8HGI-x10E_IG2GDoEBshoRp47hiurGEccI-SPwGHjtM7Z-OgEv9u6KiT2v1nyAAhHggf90Y8bUH2g4kZsQAj0Zu3L9BA_rPOdAAdQ2NOI6xEY1_n-tum-TauSXw_j_XgP7n9t5Q5J_3zcTlG8HRzYMH9gFE_2BCA9ATD3yP7GmQ8RIQEFNACO7076Jx-GwMekgxa9D9BHWQNgsHYPgRXRBYBkESDFnvdYB8iDyG7lYAYdxHjTyfjaG2VDbD2EcBHVwIovA-D8AEYIYQIjmmiLaOIiR24QAsLgjegEI7hmyJbMAEiA4BAgOyGB2pdSBGAbsSIAQo7KNUdQdR3dPjgx-L_DKPsAEmAMFwPo8jG4bwwtsXYOEwEtHMaHPAXA6DuB4CXYuPtNQSAtH5MuAgYIb0-MkJggsGAZ35qHT49A4nHSzjbBWMNp4WPrFtVxSMN5DmAC1TujRwjT2-qHbWW0mDZGHBSeEZTymJwKUUvAJTmA1M7rkepwwvp_wrkbE2DcKZDxGAom2aIsRrxUCzbO4MJBgCwHrWJRB_goBghdHgkBpykEppkUQ0ALD-XAVQX6b0_Dsi2kBKBVcuI1TqhGexDoYnCxHvkdyhM-I_gSo8phdhlSOBcG4Iu3hfD-ECLAEIPBwjaJiMIpIls0hpiYTQp4rwQqGRAMyBaUxkHrCcIjLOHxtpiwLpsGQ2QwB0B4MrM65RIBPSeDs8gg88yZ0-WwGQdweCwBeMiLYPNOLXAkjLLcEYuL4O-VFIQvyWH4ukOw4FXCwW8KhfwqIsL4jwtSFxdATCd4MGURS4UYh1g6sOrcB4qKAAc6Vzy0rIJARgGYQasv0mQGCo48DFACNvbZzU1Y13NOtUAYBrYqGHBjYcQEojaTrlBGCwh9itJnF-EqTL0DSG5rXeZiRhDZqkisTNeb6yhoSMW-ZCRawMEOa6U1has0ltzfmstYhih0GgFBbKtc8DsG8lAnAnc9IpPKHaAAmsVeCJhYraGgBATU0CqRrIANwoBQFYCQsAAAUfAwCVAQM8Jde6AA8zwXhH0PRAAA1JegAlAFfZeBd0AH0pT7s4H4bqm7t5pwAHRqwWjDTdd6ABUzxelfRvSu5y8Rn2CQYG-oo4Z2Rfu-NkP9cRR50CA7AUDoxwOQbICG-UP7RGdx_STH9IB2abqQlKIgL6vwrDg62BjjBvBPrgzMyxiFzCQIXYqd6ysVgbK2Y3IOukSBtijty2OeB0iwA4wEUofYZnoA8LIpa7iRDjjFFMMQompUZrhFRFE6JMQ4jxISYkpJ6NSmuNIZ2dEcRu2YqxdinF6Nwa0-Qbj0xvg0E80prObJL4NgAGpBbTaxhgMzrl9z_I3UANBhBQPxUMa4gEo41wC88ci-zOaiiQ9bAmsBwm2i8T4rGON1QLyXjIVe6pPHeLEN0ToQ7XpUHuHwcI0Zfi_BWI0eavNjnleazwLYFgLDJF5sQMYsBmYDYq2IZwDBmTfHa1nJrPjt4SHZOGIgWIVhzvZCQtOIRDVgGcBfYYi2xu1VEvJaQj6S3xoI6oIAA

### Steps to Reproduce

1. create a chart with too many data.
2.`tooltip.trigger` must be `item`.

### Current Behavior

when hovering bars with mouse inside tooltip it allways show same value and value name.

### Expected Behavior

it should display the value of the hovering bar

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS
- Browser: Google Chrome 116.0.5845.187
- Framework: Vue.JS v2.6.14
```


### Any additional comments?

setting `tooltip.trigger` to `axis` solves issue but in my case it's has to be `item`

comment.body: seems to be caused by `large: true` in your series

issue.title: feat(i18n): add Dutch(NL) translation

## Others

comment.body:
Thanks for your contribution!
The community will review it ASAP. In the meanwhile, please checkout [the coding standard](https://echarts.apache.org/en/coding-standard.html) and Wiki about [How to make a pull request](https://github.com/apache/echarts/wiki/How-to-make-a-pull-request).

issue.title: [Bug] Does not work using Node 21.0.0

labels.name: pending
labels.description: We are not sure about whether this is a bug/new feature.

labels.name: en
labels.description: This issue is in English

issue.body:
### Version

5.4.3

### Link to Minimal Reproduction

None

### Steps to Reproduce

Upgrade Node from v20.7.0 to v21.0.0

### Current Behavior

The following error appears:

```
[...]\node_modules\.pnpm\echarts@5.4.3\node_modules\echarts\dist\echarts.js:101
        var firefox = ua.match(/Firefox\/([\d.]+)/);
                         ^

TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'match')
    at detect ([...]\node_modules\.pnpm\echarts@5.4.3\node_modules\echarts\dist\echarts.js:101:26)
    at [...]\node_modules\.pnpm\echarts@5.4.3\node_modules\echarts\dist\echarts.js:97:9
    at [...]\node_modules\.pnpm\echarts@5.4.3\node_modules\echarts\dist\echarts.js:22:68
    at Object.<anonymous> (D:\GitHub\math-engine\node_modules\.pnpm\echarts@5.4.3\node_modules\echarts\dist\echarts.js:25:2)
    at Module._compile (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1369:14)
    at Module._extensions..js (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1427:10)
    at Module.load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1201:32)
    at Module._load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1017:12)
    at Module.require (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1229:19)
    at require (node:internal/modules/helpers:177:18)
```
[...] = my project folder 

### Expected Behavior

Works as using Node v20.7.0

### Environment

_No response_

### Any additional comments?

_No response_

comment.body: In node 21.1.0 navigator has now userAgent. Is your issue now solved?

### Steps to Reproduce

1. create a chart with too many data.
2.`tooltip.trigger` must be `item`.

### Current Behavior

when hovering bars with mouse inside tooltip it allways show same value and value name.

### Expected Behavior

it should display the value of the hovering bar

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS
- Browser: Google Chrome 116.0.5845.187
- Framework: Vue.JS v2.6.14
```


### Any additional comments?

setting `tooltip.trigger` to `axis` solves issue but in my case it's has to be `item`

comment.body:
I'm sorry to close this issue for it lacks the necessary title. Please provide **a _descriptive_ and as _concise_ as possible title to describe your problems or requests** and then the maintainers or I will reopen this issue.

Every good bug report or feature request starts with a title. Your issue title is a critical element as it's the first thing maintainers see.

A good issue title makes it easier for maintainers to understand what the issue is, easily locate it, and know what steps they'll need to take to fix it.

Moreover, it's better to include keywords, as this makes it easier to find the issue self and similar issues in searches.

issue.title: [Bug]

labels.description: This issue is missing a descriptive title.

issue.title: [Bug]

5.2.2

https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?code=PYBwLglsB2AEC8sDeAoWsAeBBDEDOAXLANprrJnmzQCGAtgKYAqDGYAymAJ4A2DRqKlQDGwHsABORAOQBiAMyLplcgF8ANCvQ1ceADI0ARgx4Ct5AGYwwAMXoQeXGQCVgh4GGDrYWCRBo83gASJgBuDJDCNN54NNB4ALR4DH4W0ppC5HgAFsAA7kRgEgCuDBmZsPgAojw8ECB4-IUlZeboJnUN-ADCwMXQYEQAjAAM5Zn4TKAAIvnQRBYByeNC2RAAJgwA8uESPDQgzaUrImKSMgpKJ5bW7BAAXvywQwBM1-gSHjRgTwCcY21KgMUqEAkQRuYNOYNjJ1jx1nQEgwACyGADs2RGAFYLKFhAArPIWF4jdLmHL5I6tTK0RgyMmZbggJ7SKI_ADmki4DKEIGAjUgMBk7jAnjoPKotIYemAbKg81g0joGzhDAl5DoOiI0GKtWuyoVOr15h0kwgwgA1mYKrAKQVYEVjoC6tAGJxeE9BDbYKJxFJFZd5MobVCbRBgRJQaZnpDrqb9OHPYC7VT3rAXW7uHxrd6Uw6Wmn0L7zgHFEHAapY-Z3P11jQJFwAOIHIjEaSk7zSIYAUmkAF1riAJAxQlBingAKqHRUAOWAoXV6CHI7HeCYJWgwgY6xkJJe8lgc9CCSG5aolfQA7I2F08mmrav6C4OCaJBUXsl9GYrA4WaTNuLf05GRBgaHkX40WDIRQyEeMDGMaMPyEPNHWpCo1k2HYUn2adULTQCLhAsCIKg89rhhRUEQSEYADZsWJeQsRoZFfnkHgXheRdqC_elriZFko1KLi-QFeUZD4CwwC4qUZTlIVFWVdZVS4lCC3MA1wXI6BdmSBYljQqg4MTHNMlUp0bQzd1swob1bVye08MBIsziAwNSOgqtTJAOowD0YybIqMyGE82DdCYc0rQC0z7NTZ1Eys_9vQI0slArSEVAvWBH1gZ9b3vEhsvuF9CAK8oiryh9ynjAAFYBwx-f1iGy9k_HWO9KrIRpoHZPhio6pd6wCPhoya8oQEG2oTD60qyCiPhoDrRrssMEocn69MGHZBgFtbd9yRi2BFh4ZIMrIbLPDEdwMF2qgkPQO1wrAayjuWcxPGnE8Ri-64guuCxQLAYphxMoQ6zAGgAC1gGAOgQeiyl83M71cvwABJBbWBkaAYDVNLMky9BMuysHIeh2G31u_aEcczIbzRjHrpIEZsqoFbx2ydgTAYYRBkO_S-K4ZkZDwOpNgkLjJAgbbeekXI_HuawAnconygkGhFvWvl9iWqrut63R1rV9YIHHabRs6lIpZKpCACINhtogbao2j6P3JiWLYjibZWG3-Id2AbcMetvZUG2pX9m2sFqWBXDyPAQ6oG28DoaGwGyf2XoMgPk9T7IAFkYA8HGI-x10E_IG2GDoEBshoRp47hiurGEccI-SPwGHjtM7Z-OgEv9u6KiT2v1nyAAhHggf90Y8bUH2g4kZsQAj0Zu3L9BA_rPOdAAdQ2NOI6xEY1_n-tum-TauSXw_j_XgP7n9t5Q5J_3zcTlG8HRzYMH9gFE_2BCA9ATD3yP7GmQ8RIQEFNACO7076Jx-GwMekgxa9D9BHWQNgsHYPgRXRBYBkESDFnvdYB8iDyG7lYAYdxHjTyfjaG2VDbD2EcBHVwIovA-D8AEYIYQIjmmiLaOIiR24QAsLgjegEI7hmyJbMAEiA4BAgOyGB2pdSBGAbsSIAQo7KNUdQdR3dPjgx-L_DKPsAEmAMFwPo8jG4bwwtsXYOEwEtHMaHPAXA6DuB4CXYuPtNQSAtH5MuAgYIb0-MkJggsGAZ35qHT49A4nHSzjbBWMNp4WPrFtVxSMN5DmAC1TujRwjT2-qHbWW0mDZGHBSeEZTymJwKUUvAJTmA1M7rkepwwvp_wrkbE2DcKZDxGAom2aIsRrxUCzbO4MJBgCwHrWJRB_goBghdHgkB 1. create a chart with too many data.
2.`tooltip.trigger` must be `item`.

### Current Behavior

when hovering bars with mouse inside tooltip it allways show same value and value name.

### Expected Behavior

it should display the value of the hovering bar

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS
- Browser: Google Chrome 116.0.5845.187
- Framework: Vue.JS v2.6.14
```

### Any additional comments?

setting `tooltip.trigger` to `axis` solves issue but in my case it's has to be `item`

issue.title: Bar Chart: Hide Bar which are having values 0 in them

labels.name: pending
labels.description: We are not sure about whether this is a bug/new feature.

labels.name: en
labels.description: This issue is in English

issue.body:
### Version

5.4

### Link to Minimal Reproduction

https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?c=dataset-simple0

### Steps to Reproduce

In Multiple Bar chart , if some data value has zero then it is not hiding fully in chart, it is taking space in between them.
![image](https://github.com/apache/echarts/assets/149141850/f7e56b2c-48b5-43a2-916a-72ac8dad363b)
[](url)
![chartIssue](https://github.com/apache/echarts/assets/149141850/c1424004-b379-4b6c-a79a-0e1da452a47c)


### Current Behavior

In Multiple Bar chart , if some data value has zero then it is not hiding fully in chart, it is taking space in between them.

### Expected Behavior

Hide Bars in chart if the value is 0 or null or undefined.

### Environment

```markdown
- OS:
- Browser:
- Framework:
```


### Any additional comments?

_No response_

comment.body: You could try using `xAxis: {type: 'value}` as outlined [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/77160878/echarts4r-bar-plot-how-to-prevent-x-axis-categories-from-being-plotted-if-th/77187313#77187313) and see if it resolves your use case.

issue.title: Bar Chart: Hide Bar which are having values 0 in them
issue.body:
### Version

5.4

### Link to Minimal Reproduction

https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?c=dataset-simple0

### Steps to Reproduce

In Multiple Bar chart , if some data value has zero then it is not hiding fully in chart, it is taking space in between them.
![image](https://github.com/apache/echarts/assets/149141850/f7e56b2c-48b5-43a2-916a-72ac8dad363b)
[](url)
![chartIssue](https://github.com/apache/echarts/assets/149141850/c1424004-b379-4b6c-a79a-0e1da452a47c)


### Current Behavior

In Multiple Bar chart , if some data value has zero then it is not hiding fully in chart, it is taking space in between them.

### Expected Behavior

Hide Bars in chart if the value is 0 or null or undefined.

### Environment

```markdown
- OS:
- Browser:
- Framework:
```


### Any additional comments?

_No response_

issue.title: echarts动态数据+时间坐标轴 内存溢出，页面崩溃

labels.name: pending
labels.description: We are not sure about whether this is a bug/new feature.

issue.body:
<!--
为了方便我们能够复现和修复 bug，请遵从下面的规范描述您的问题。
-->


### One-line summary [问题简述]
动态绘制实时曲线，前端使用vue框架，绘制曲线的组件中保证只有一个echarts实例。同时最多绘制8条曲线，每条曲线最多有900个点组成（由于过多点页面卡顿且很快崩溃，每秒更新一次数据。初始渲染整个option，更新时渲染option中的series。目前测试，曲线绘制大概达到15个小时，页面崩溃，内存占用已达到一两个G。经测试发现使用setOption更新数据的前后时间差初始在450ms左右，运行一段一两个小时之后，该时间差偶尔能达到1s。




### Version & Environment [版本及环境]
+ ECharts version [ECharts 版本]:3.7.1
+ Browser version [浏览器类型和版本]:谷歌  60.0.3112.90（正式版本）
+ OS Version [操作系统类型和版本]:win7 64位





### Expected behaviour [期望结果]
实时曲线一直运行，不卡顿不崩溃。




### ECharts option [ECharts配置项]
<!-- Copy and paste your 'echarts option' here. -->
<!-- [下方贴你的option，注意不要删掉下方 ```javascript 和 尾部的 ``` 字样。最好是我们能够直接运行的 option。如何得到能运行的 option 参见上方的 guidelines for contributing] -->
```javascript
option = title: {
            text: ''
          },
          tooltip: {
              trigger: 'axis'
          },
          legend: {
            top: 10,
            left: 'center',
            data: this.legendMsg
          },
          xAxis: {
              type: 'time',
              splitNumber:20,
              splitLine: {
                  show: false
              }
          },
          yAxis: {
              type: 'value',
              splitLine: {
                  show: false
              }
          },
          series: this.msg
}
//var num=0;
//num++
//series为数据，存储多组曲线的配置及数据。arr为与“动态数据+时间坐标轴”中数据结构一致。
      series[num]={
                name: obj,
                type: 'line',
                step:'start',
                showSymbol: false,
                hoverAnimation: false,
                data: arr
              }

```




### Other comments [其他信息]
<!-- For example: Screenshot or Online demo -->
<!-- [例如，截图或线上实例 (JSFiddle/JSBin/Codepen)] -->

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20189143/33252784-18671d3a-d37b-11e7-831d-524c6e67f909.png)

issue.title: VisualMap: compute colors depending on values

labels.name: en
labels.description: This issue is in English

issue.body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Sometimes I do not know all the values that will come from the backend. Still, I'd like specific values/categories to have stable colors no matter how many or in which order will be retrieved. 

Currently I do have defined colors for a few values and for the rest I'm hashing the values and generating unique color codes, but I have to do it by generating `chart/series.color` property based on the data. I'd prefer to have a native way of doing it in ECharts.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Introduce third way of mapping next to  'Linear Mapping' and 'Table Mapping'. It could be called 'Functional Mapping'.

Each of the visual channels (color, symbol, etc.) could take a function apart from an array or a map. Implementation would be very similar to Table Mapping, but instead of:
```javascript
channel[value]
```
would do
```javascript
channel(value)
```

Seems like a relatively easy change.
<!-- This issue is generated by echarts-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->
<!-- This issue is in English. DO NOT REMOVE -->

issue.title: Examples using English

labels.name: doc
labels.description: Document or Website related issues.

labels.name: en
labels.description: This issue is in English

issue.body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Examples using Chinese are sometimes hard to grasp. Using English in examples in case if English language is selected would be helpful for those not understanding Mandarin.

Example: https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?c=doc-example/scatter-visualMap-categories&edit=1&reset=1

### What does the proposed API look like?
I'd expect to be able to create multiple version of examples, say
`doc-example/en/scatter-visualMap-categories` that bases on `doc-example/scatter-visualMap-categories`.

In case there is an example in language currently selected it would take priority over the general one.

https://echarts.apache.org/en/contributing.html would also include information how to contribute translated examples.

<!-- This issue is generated by echarts-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->
<!-- This issue is in English. DO NOT REMOVE -->

issue.title: Mapbox中添加Echarts-gl lines3D线条显示不连续

labels.name: pending
labels.description: We are not sure about whether this is a bug/new feature.

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Inactive for a long time. Will be closed in 7 days.

issue.body:
### Version
5.2.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsbin.com/wojejoruzi/1/edit?html,console,output](https://jsbin.com/wojejoruzi/1/edit?html,console,output)

### Steps to reproduce
给mapbox对象设置倾角即可发现线条不连续问题

### What is expected?
lines3D线条应该始终保持连续

### What is actually happening?
迁移百度地图公车轨迹示例，在mapboxgl.js2.5.1中添加echarts-gl2.0.8的lines3D，数据源为示例数据，当mapbox倾角不为0时线条虚化不连续。并且当地图初始倾角为0时，不改变地图倾角的情况下，使用鼠标滚轮将线条放大到一定程度就会消失。
![T`W7V(@IQDH%S%%XO U`RHM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80465480/137666492-5507ed2c-1f49-4056-8745-dd9e44a5383c.png)


---
倾角特别大的时候，lines3D还会飘在半空中
![VB@L%EV) D~9R{}`_U@0PQI](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80465480/137666712-aeb7e6ea-4983-4841-a1d4-91126b601d99.png)
